availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John K. Faulkner (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married to Elizabeth Bell Faulkner in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, on September 7, 1859. Father of John Faulkner. Farmer in Garrard County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a major, lieutenant colonel, and colonel from April 16, 1862 to July 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 765.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 34B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0078.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 001689805, p. 43.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 180-181.
"John Kavanaugh Faulkner (1838-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 10434738, accessed November 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10434738.
